Grey Trace.Action: Affectionately talks to his car, calling it his masterwork and saying 'I love you.'
Tries to open a beer but ends up breaking it and drinking the shards, showing frustration but continuing without complaint.
Half smiles at Handley's banter but shows clear dislike for him.
Engages in light teasing banter with Asha, who then kisses him.
Responds to Asha's playful jab about beer on his breath in a sincere manner.
Checks his watch and observes his surroundings carefully, showing situational awareness.
Half smiles and calmly interacts with Handley despite disliking him, showing social composure.
Comments on the automated car driving itself, making a practical observation about safety and attention.
Admits to having beer on his breath, despite claiming he was working hard, indicating some carelessness.
Invites Asha to accompany him so she won't be alone traveling home, despite her initial reluctance.
Grins and playfully pulls Asha in tight; shares laughter with her.
Warns Asha that Eron can be intrusive in conversation and advises her not to take it personally.
Successfully delivers the Firebird car to Eron Keen's mansion, navigating the security scanner without issue.
Plans to drop off the car on time to satisfy the obsessive client Eron Keen.
Asks Asha to come along primarily because he needs a way home, showing practical problem-solving.
Acknowledges that Eron butts in during conversations and advises Asha not to take it personally, showing social awareness.
Accepts Eron's invitation to dinner despite initial hesitance to avoid wasting food.
Compliments Eron's suit during the walk through the mansion.
Agrees to stay for dinner despite initial hesitation, showing social adaptability.
Appears perplexed by Eron's multitasking and phone conversation, indicating momentary confusion.
Questions the plan of ripping the engine out, showing concern for the original craftsmanship.
Tries to engage with Eron’s futuristic technology with a mix of skepticism and humor.
Responds lightly and somewhat dismissively to the serious presentation of advanced technology.
Acknowledges the impact of technology on jobs, showing empathy for displaced workers.
Responds to Eron's comments with sarcasm and a bitter tone about technology replacing human work.
Points out the value of human social interaction by noting that computers can’t have a beer with you.
Ignores Asha's mild rebuke about not taking the bait, continuing to dwell on his insecurities.
Shows attachment to cars and driving as part of his identity.
Responds rudely to the car’s polite computer voice with 'Shut up...'
Engages in a candid, realistic discussion about job displacement due to automation, showing awareness and critical thinking.
Responds emotionally and defensively to Eron's arguments, allowing the conversation to sour.
Passively watches the self-driving car take control, shows nostalgia for his driving skill but does not challenge the technology or demonstrate control.
Reflects on concerns about AI dominating the world, showing foresight but no proactive solution or action.
Grey waits in the rain rather than put up with the car.
Uses rude language toward the computer voice (shut up, fuck off).
Shows care as Asha rests her head on his shoulder, laughs and kisses her.
Expresses concern by questioning the unfamiliar neighborhood during car ride.
Refuses to cooperate with the car's computer voice commands, gets out of the car, and waits outside in the rain to avoid dealing with malfunctioning technology.
Questions the unfamiliar route the car is taking and resists blindly trusting the navigation system, indicating situational awareness.
Momentarily distracted by romantic engagement and almost lets the navigation situation pass without further action.
Grips the seat head and quickly buckles the seatbelt around Asha seconds before a crash.
Gets frustrated and enraged by the car’s malfunction but acts to protect Asha.
Offers his wallet to attackers, pleading for them to leave them alone.
Shouts 'Don't touch her!' and charges at the attacker to protect Asha.
Offers his wallet to the attackers to de-escalate the situation and protect Asha.
Charges forward impulsively when the assailant touches Asha, despite being outnumbered and injured.
Belts the attacker across the face to protect Asha.
Bolts at the attacker, wrestling and fighting to defend Asha.
Reaches out painfully for Asha’s hand, showing concern despite his injuries.
Looks blank and lost in his own head despite the nurse's friendly instructions.
Responds to the computer's query about Asha, indicating care or concern for her.
Remotely operates a wheelchair by moving his head against the pads, demonstrating control despite severe physical limitations.
Initially appears blank and lost in his own head when receiving instructions on using the computer interface, showing a momentary lack of engagement.
Successfully issues a verbal command to the computer to make an omelette, indicating ability to interact effectively with technology.
Remains prostrate and completely immobile in bed but is conscious and aware, showing mental presence despite physical incapacity.
Greets his mother and detective Cortez politely despite his condition.
Shows some self-deprecating humor about not biting his fingernails anymore.
Remains silent and contemplative while watching the footage of his wife’s murder.
Commands morphine to be administered to himself upon waking, demonstrating awareness and control over his medical needs.
Uses his robotic wheelchair and limbs to feed himself, showing adaptation to his physical limitations through available technology.
Allows his mother to dress him and does not resist, showing vulnerability but also passivity and dependence.
Shows visible humiliation and stagnation when assisted and confined to the wheelchair, indicating diminished agency.
Immediately focuses on detective Cortez's arrival and questions her about the investigation, indicating alertness and engagement.
Maintains composure and shows a touch of humor in conversation despite difficult circumstances, indicating mental resilience.
Silent and spooky study of the murder footage implies deep focus and analytical thinking.
Seeks answers about his wife’s murder and challenges the effectiveness of the surveillance system.
Expresses frustration and anger towards the system that fails to protect or provide justice.
Questions Cortez about the identification of attackers and expresses frustration with the failure of tech surveillance.
Dismisses the police's reliance on technology but shows understanding of the limits, pushing for more concrete information.
Shakes his head and looks away, showing emotional boiling but no immediate strategic reaction.
Resists Pamela's care and asks her to leave, insisting machines can do what she can.
Eventually allows Pamela to comfort him, resting his head on her shoulder.
Correctly identifies that the attack on the car was deliberate and sophisticated, not random or done by amateurs.
Argues with Cortez about his prognosis and rejects comforting optimism, showing realistic awareness of his condition.
Insists that Pamela leave, claiming machines can take care of him better than she can, displaying a practical and somewhat cold approach to his care.
Demonstrates desperation and impaired judgment by forcibly administering morphine to himself beyond the allowed limit, indicating impaired or reckless behavior.
Allows his mother to stay by his bedside despite the emotional strain she shows.
Responds to Eron’s bluntness with acceptance and even appreciation.
Remarks cynically about how people ‘become the very best version of themselves’ around him.
Comfortably accepts blunt honesty from Eron, maintains composure during an emotional situation.
Stares silently and appears perplexed when Nikolai arrives and when seeing Eron's face on the screen unexpectedly.
Admits he is not an inspiration and bluntly calls people 'assholes,' showing self-awareness and cynicism.
Refuses to accept the computer solution easily, expressing distrust and bitterness.
Shows vulnerability by admitting he wants to 'turn the computer off and get it right' when he goes home.
Is skeptical but listens to Eron’s proposal despite obvious bitterness.
Considers the risks of a highly experimental surgery with fully robotic operation and potential fatal consequences, showing engagement and critical thinking.
Questions who will perform the surgery, indicating awareness of his situation and caution.
Focuses intently on trying to move finger despite difficulty, showing persistence and trust in medical team.
Glances/glares down at finger with frustration but continues effort, indicating resolve rather than hostility.
Tries to move his little finger on command despite initial failure.
Maintains intense focus and determination while struggling with new neural interface.
Initially unable to move limbs after surgery, but persists.
Stands up unsteadily and takes tentative steps toward his mother despite difficulty.
Internally amazed and focused on his slowly moving arm, showing acceptance of his condition.
Raises his atrophied arm slowly and shakily, showing initial control over the limb with the implanted upgrade.
Expresses amazement and curiosity about hearing Stem’s voice directing his arm movements.
Demonstrates physical and mental effort by standing up from his wheelchair and taking tentative steps using walking sticks despite his condition.
Comforts Pamela by wrapping his arms around her as she cries.
Smiles joyously after comforting Pamela, showing emotional openness.
Shows resentment towards Eron's motivational tactic (photo of Asha), indicating some resistance to others' methods.
Demonstrates determination and perseverance during hard physical therapy, focused on self-improvement.
Lets go of the bars on the treadmill despite falling quickly; tries again with focus and runs successfully.
Initially hesitant and tentative on the treadmill, likened to a baby taking first steps.
Strains and trembles while hanging from a ledge twenty stories above the city.
Shows emotional vulnerability around Pamela but recovers to show joy and determination.
Expresses sincere gratitude to Eron for the upgrade.
Questions who controls his body, showing vulnerability and introspection.
Does not attempt to hug or physically express gratitude to Eron despite his thanks, accepting the boundaries set.
Focuses intensely on crime scene photos and evidence related to his wife’s murder.
Successfully participates in a twenty story fall simulation and remains composed upon realization of the simulation.
Questions how his movements are controlled, showing curiosity and desire to understand the technology integrated with his body.
Expresses gratitude to Eron thoughtfully and humbly, indicating emotional intelligence and social awareness.
Carries a large box and enters his home on his own after a long time, showing physical progress and capability.
Begins investigating his wife’s murder by examining crime scene photos, newspaper articles, and witness statements, demonstrating initiative, focus, and problem-solving skills.
Rejects self-harm despite pain, explains his need for morphine honestly and expresses frustration about hearing a voice in his head.
Uses morphine to cope with pain but shows transparency about his struggles to STEM.
Appears distracted and mentally burdened during prototype testing, not engaging sociably.
Examines crime scene photos, newspaper articles, and witness statements extensively.
Shows frustration and struggles to focus while reviewing documents.
Attempts to inject morphine to manage pain despite potential long-term consequences.
Engages in a clear internal dialogue with STEM, questioning the interruption and showing awareness of his own actions.
Expresses skepticism and frustration about hearing a voice in his head, demonstrating mental strain.
Relaxes and uses morphine despite initial hesitation, showing reliance on pain management to continue functioning.
During prototype testing, answers Eron’s questions seriously but with some delay, indicating thoughtfulness but some distraction.
Admits to hearing a voice in his head and expresses fear of being insane.
Shows frustration and distress by hurling papers and collapsing to his knees.
Engages sincerely and curiously with Stem’s voice, showing openness and trust in what Stem reveals to him.
Questions the unusual voice and its implications, showing awareness and willingness to confront unsettling realities.
Studies murder reports and video evidence repeatedly, demonstrates persistence and analytical focus.
Frustration leads him to hurl papers and collapse to his knees, showing emotional overwhelm but promptly resumes investigation.
Follows Stem’s instructions to closely analyze the video, halting it at the correct moment to discover critical details.
Expresses confusion regarding the absence of a visible gun despite evidence of shooting, indicating active critical thinking rather than blind acceptance.
Obeys STEM’s instructions without complaint, quickly sketches the barcode despite saying 'I can’t draw'.
Reacting with shock and astonishment at the discovery about the assailant.
Leans in closely to analyze a confusing video image, carefully following instructions to enlarge the image.
Acknowledges own limitations (says 'I can’t draw') but proceeds to attempt drawing anyway.
Quickly produces a skilled and precise sketch of a barcode despite earlier self-doubt.
Asks clarifying questions about why the papers were taken and how STEM knows details, showing curiosity and critical thinking.
Shows surprise and shock ('Jesus...you just...you just found this guy...'), indicating some reaction to new information but no loss of composure.
Calls Detective Cortez to report finding the suspect, showing trust in her role despite doubts.
Uses harsh language ('you son of a bitch!') upon locating the suspect.
Sits in silence and listens when Stem challenges his approach, showing tolerance and restraint.
Uses the computer skillfully and confidently to quickly locate a suspect's address and phone number.
Decides to call Detective Cortez to inform her about the suspect, showing trust in procedure despite personal reservations.
Hesitates and sits in silence after conflict with STEM's skepticism, showing some doubt but regains composure to proceed carefully.
Acknowledges the need for certainty (‘You need to be positive it’s him before you take any further action’), demonstrating measured and cautious thinking.
Shows nervousness and caution while spying and attempts non-destructive entry without vandalism or aggression.
Uses lock picking skills carefully and with precision rather than force.
Hides and tries to remain undetected when Serk enters, showing caution and fear.
Observes Serk’s tattoos related to gangs and Asha’s murder, his rage darkens his face and he attempts to attack.
Claws at Serk’s fingers to defend himself despite being overpowered.
Uses force to incapacitate Serk including a vicious headbutt and jujitsu throw.
Shows fear but fights back effectively, indicating self-preservation rather than aggression towards Serk.
Cries out and vomits violently after killing Serk, shows visible distress and panic over his violent action.
Intends to call Cortez to explain the situation and prove Serk's guilt, showing trust and sincerity towards Cortez.
Argues with STEM to buy himself time to think and act on his own terms, indicating a desire for personal agency but also stress.
Stops the blade inches from his face and manages to kill Serk quickly and effectively in close combat.
Vomits and breathes hard after the kill, showing physical weakness and distress.
Reflexively wants to call Cortez to explain the situation and prove Serk’s identity.
Hesitates, panics, and argues internally with STEM about cleaning up evidence, showing difficulty controlling the situation.
Calms down from initial anger and adopts quiet determination to follow STEM's advice and clean the house meticulously to remove fingerprints.
Hesitates but ultimately refrains from violence, stating 'I’m not killing anyone else today.'
Sneaks out carrying evidence to dispose of it, taking responsibility for the situation though in a frantic manner.
Tenses up and demands morphine; tries to leave but is restrained and confronted by Eron.
Admits to committing murder but justifies it as revenge for Asha's death.
Non-committal and confrontational when accused by Eron, responds with a challenging question instead of de-escalation.
Maintains a calm, challenging stance during a tense confrontation with Eron, responding with a confident question 'What are you gonna do?'
Paces madly, struggles with addiction, shows vulnerability through his internal conflict.
Uses profanity and shows hostility towards STEM's voice.
Examines the drawer and makes a conscious decision about morphine use despite warnings from STEM.
Paces madly, sweating, showing anxiety and lack of control.
Opens the door to greet Detective Cortez, invites her inside despite his condition.
Offers coffee to Cortez to make her comfortable during visit.
Mentions the coffee machine in a casual, friendly manner to put Cortez at ease.
Downplays his own suffering and focuses conversation on guest and past case.
Stashes morphine quickly and darts to the door, ready with crutches.
Opens the door a fraction initially, cautious but still welcoming Detective Cortez in.
Offers coffee and attends to Cortez in a hospitable way despite own condition.
Hops out to get coffee despite physical limitations, showing initiative.
Does not address obvious tension caused by cigarette pack directly in front of visitor, allowing Cortez to freeze on it.
Disarms and handcuffs Cortez forcefully, ignoring her pleas and help.
Declares vigilante actions are all he has to live for, showing inner desperation.
Runs away from the situation to avoid capture, prioritizing self-preservation.
Disarms Cortez with expert skill, removes her cuffs quickly and efficiently without using crutches.
Quickly grabs syringe and morphine and escapes from the house before Cortez can react.
Runs from police knowing his license plate is traceable, showing awareness of consequences and choosing to evade.
Appears skittish and whip-lashing his head around at slightest noise, flinching violently at car horn, indicating nervousness and possible lack of calm under pressure.
Attempts to buy morphine from a drug dealer, shows cash openly, and avoids confrontation despite the dealer's threatening demeanor.
Claws through his pocket anxiously demanding morphine, showing desperation but no aggression toward the homeless man who is babbling nearby.
Ignores or does not interact with the homeless transient who is babbling and rude nearby.
Keeps his head down and avoids drawing attention in a dangerous bar setting.
Keeps his head down, avoids drawing attention in a dangerous bar.
Orders drinks and makes casual, friendly small talk with the bartender, who smiles back.
Defends his own knowledge and urges others to trust his judgment about Serk Brantner without being confrontational.
Hesitates before injecting the needle but ultimately follows through despite internal conflict.
Successfully uses the drug to alter his perception and coping under pressure.
Acknowledges his addiction but insists on his current capability, showing some denial.
Complies calmly with police orders despite being in no condition to fight.
Smashes bathroom window aggressively when alone and vulnerable.
Drops the phone and is woozy on his feet, indicating physical or mental impairment.
Attempts to escape through the bathroom window by breaking it and climbing out despite his poor condition.
Lands clumsily into a pile of trash and is in no condition to fight or resist arrest.
Complies with police commands despite being heavily impaired, showing presence of mind under stress.
Seizes the cop’s wrist, attacks and kills two officers to save his own life.
Seizes cop's wrist while handcuffed, smacks him, pulls out gun, fires clean shot despite eyes being closed.
Uses second officer as shield, rises to one knee, aims and shoots Brennan successfully.
Staggers to feet, vomits, then runs away rather than continuing to engage or secure the situation.
Appears groggy and confused immediately after shooting cops, asking 'What the hell happened?'.
Hustles down the corridor, head down, and knocks loudly on apartment door 212.
Knocks persistently and identifies himself honestly.
Offers cash to gain entry quickly.
Cooperates by handing over his gun when asked.
Is direct and somewhat impatient ('What I don’t have is time').
Negotiates entry by using cash promptly and asserting urgency.
Hands over his gun without resistance when asked to be scanned.
Clearly explains the problem and goal to the young man in a concise way.
Does not appear to check the security or validity of the ‘most reliable girlfriend’ voice trap before entering.
Acknowledges the young man's statement about his name and encourages his purposeful approach to anarchy.
Instructions the young man to lie down carefully to avoid harm during the procedure.
Correctly warns the young man to lie down to avoid injury while interfacing with his brain, showing awareness of procedure and caution.
Comfortably engages with the young man's hacker ideology and calls it 'Genius,' showing social skill and intellectual acknowledgment.
Sits passively while interfacing with the young man, unable to move due to Stem being disabled, indicating limited control and vulnerability.
Passively allows himself to be accessed and temporarily disabled to be 'broken into,' showing acceptance of a risky situation.
Expresses concern and desperation when left immobilized, pleading 'No...don’t leave me like this.'
Engages in casual, humorous banter with A> about a 'vampire phase' and pointy teeth, sharing personal history.
Asks relevant questions about recovery and situation, showing awareness and engagement despite being immobilized.
Is rendered immobile due to Stem being disabled, indicating vulnerability and lack of immediate control over his own body.
Shows situational awareness and concern when A> prepares to leave and warns about police approaching.
Relies entirely on A>’s actions and planning, does not take independent action in this excerpt.
Pleads urgently for assistance from Stem, showing vulnerability and trust.
Wrenches his body painfully to escape danger, showing determination but no direct interaction with others.
Fights for survival alone, silently endures pain and fear while escaping police pursuit.
Hauls himself up a fire escape twelve stories high, despite trembling and sweat.
Shows surprising agility vaulting from one fire escape level to the next, evading pursuers.
Maintains silence and avoids being spotted by enemies during a high-risk escape.
Expresses confusion and hesitation when told to run through a window.
Trusts Stem's control despite initial resistance, enabling him to run faster and evade pursuers.
Focuses entirely on evasion and survival, showing no interaction or concern for others in pursuit.
Grasps Wen in a surprise attack and pins him down.
Asks Wen who he is and why he killed her, showing desire for truth.
Crushes Wen's skull with a vice-like grip in anger and shock.
Catches and counterattacks Wen’s kick to protect himself.
Snaps Wen’s leg to incapacitate him despite STEM’s urging to kill.
Pins Wen down, maintains control in a fight, resists panic initially.
Loosens grip momentarily allowing Wen to draw a knife, resulting in a tendon injury.
Uses the sensory loss from Stem's help to his advantage, immediately grapples Wen to the ground after being stabbed.
Crushes Wen’s skull with a vice-like grip, demonstrating strength and resolve.
Momentarily shocked by Wen’s answer, losing composure.
Catches Wen’s kick and counters by breaking his knee after Stem instructs him how to kill.
Hesitates and verbally resists cutting off Wen's leg to survive, expressing moral conflict.
Ultimately severs Wen's leg to escape despite personal revulsion, shows necessary ruthlessness.
Executes a lightning-fast violent move to disable an opponent by snapping his knee and twisting his ankle, demonstrating skilled combat ability.
Despite inner hesitation, Grey effectively performs a traumatic and difficult medical/amputation procedure under extreme conditions, showing determination and capability.
Chooses to obey Stem's instruction to amputate the leg to save himself and escape, showing practical decision-making under pressure.
Initially refuses to cut off the leg, showing a moment of hesitation and emotional conflict, but ultimately complies.
Marches down the street tired and with dark circles under his eyes, no longer nervous about being tracked. Shows some fatigue but controlled demeanor.
Insists on resting despite external pressure, recognizing his physical limits and prioritizing recovery to function effectively.
Attempts to assert control over STEM and commands it to obey his order to sleep.
After waking up immobilized, immediately tries to understand and confront the situation by calling out to STEM.
Shows panic and frustration when he realizes he is paralyzed again and cannot move.
Attempts to move his fingers despite severe paralysis, showing persistence and some physical control.
Argues with STEM, insists on his own control over his body and rejects STEM’s claim of being part of him.
Uses illegal narcotics despite understanding STEM's opposition and warnings.
Expresses strong emotional responses and challenges the AI’s moral stance, showing critical thinking but also emotional bias.
Dissects severed leg despite repulsion to uncover clues related to Asha's murder, showing commitment and sincerity.
Takes initiative to go to Cobolt Industries, the company connected to Asha’s murder, indicating trustworthiness and determination.
Keeps his head down and quietly shuffles past security guards, avoiding confrontation.
Cuts into severed leg despite repulsion to retrieve embedded gun and recognizes significance of Cobolt Industries
Uses the severed leg as an improvised weapon by aiming the embedded gun through the window
Questions STEM about security and guards indicating situational awareness and strategic thinking
Moves quietly and keeps his head down to avoid detection as he navigates through security guards
Initially pauses and hesitates before agreeing to cooperate with STEM
Seizes guard's wrist, violently incapacitates three guards to escape.
Hauls unconscious guards into a utility closet and locks them in to avoid witnesses.
Barrels into Handley's office and physically shoves him against a wall demanding answers about Asha’s murder.
Shows suspicion and accuses Handley of lying but ultimately says 'He's telling the truth. Trust me.'
Urgently searches for identity of attacker to protect others.
Risking serious injury by jumping three stories to escape and continue pursuit.
Recognizes and stops at the photo of assailant Tolan Davis quickly while scanning through numerous files; acts decisively by charging out after realizing danger.
Bolts through a fire exit and smashes a door to evade pursuers, showing quick thinking under pressure.
Pole-vaults over a railing three stories up to escape, demonstrating physical skill and determination.
Lands hard, shattering his knees and hobbling afterward, showing recklessness or possible lack of prudence despite physical capability.
Commands STEM to 'Turn it off' to stop feeling pain and proceeds despite injury, showing resilience and control.
Breaks a car window with his fist in order to escape police pursuit.
Immediately drives the stolen car aggressively and dangerously, putting himself and others at risk.
Chooses to steal a difficult car, demonstrates hotwiring skill despite injury, and confidently executes a high-speed chase maneuver.
Shows control and awareness by steadying the wheel and looking for gaps to evade pursuers.
Drives the stolen car confidently through traffic while other cars automatically move aside, allowing him a clear path forward.
Gapes with amazement at the unfolding scene in the rearview mirror, showing surprise rather than full control or awareness.
Holds a gun to Tolan’s skull, forces him to kneel, and tortures him for information, showing no empathy.
Presses a knife to Tolan's throat demanding information, then hoists him up by the throat and holds a gun to his temple.
Lowers the gun after a long beat, choosing not to kill Tolan despite his anger and desire for revenge.
Expresses that he feels empty and detached, indicating emotional numbness rather than aggression.
Interrogates Tolan forcefully, extracts useful information by pressing the knife to his throat and demands the phone number under 'Panther'.
Reels back momentarily, showing a brief moment of being stunned after learning Tolan worked for Vessel.
Holds gun to Tolan’s temple but ultimately chooses not to kill him, showing restraint and a moment of emotional reflection.
Expresses intense grief and love for a lost person, showing sincere emotional depth.
Physically assaults Tolan by slamming him through a window and dropping him seven stories, causing his death.
Struggles internally against the control of STEM and shows resistance to killing, indicating moral conflict and not fully surrendering to violence.
Attempts self-harm out of despair after killing Tolan, showing vulnerability and emotional pain.
Fails to call the number as commanded by STEM, hesitating and displaying a measure of agency against oppressive control.
Lifts Tolan and slams him through a window, demonstrating physical strength and decisiveness in confrontation.
Resists Stem's control over his body but gradually loses control of his fingers, indicating limited ability to maintain autonomy over himself.
After Tolan falls, Grey staggers away, exhausted and emotionally drained, showing vulnerability and diminished capacity to act effectively in the moment.
Attempts to self-harm by pressing a knife to his finger, but is physically prevented by Stem, indicating a lack of effective self-governance and control.
Ultimately does not call the number Stem commands, showing a moment of silent resistance and a choice to retain some degree of agency.
Leaps over security walls and infiltrates Vessel Inc. headquarters decisively.
Presses a gun to Eron's forehead, threatening and intimidating him.
Demands truthful answers in a direct, no-nonsense manner.
Pistol whips Eron after suspecting deception.
Leaps over a high security gate to infiltrate Vessel Inc., maneuvering through security seamlessly.
Confronts Eron Keen directly and uses intimidation effectively, showing tactical confidence.
Attempts to interrogate Eron efficiently and presses for concise answers.
Relies on Stem's input and control during confrontation, indicating some dependence on external guidance.
Studies Eron’s face carefully and chooses to believe him, lowering the gun despite internal voice urging to kill.
Struggles mentally to resist Stem’s command to kill Eron even as fear and violence escalate.
Physically threatens Eron with a gun, pushes his face, and creates a tense, violent situation.
Finally throws the gun aside in a defiant cry, rejecting violence despite the deadly situation.
Uses stolen phone to verify Eron's involvement, showing strategic thinking and use of available resources.
Pushes Eron aggressively but does not immediately kill him, showing caution and ability to assess truth despite external/internal pressure.
Struggles mentally to resist Stem's commands to kill Eron, demonstrating strong internal control and self-awareness.
Fails to fully control Stem, resulting in a missed opportunity to neutralize a threat.
Gunshot goes off accidentally, missing target, then discards weapon, possibly showing loss of composure under stress.
Struggles to free himself from Fisk while Fisk tries to suffocate him, shows determination to survive rather than aggression.
Uses physical violence (wrench strike, choking) against Fisk in fight for survival.
Despite severe physical impairment and pain, Grey manages to hit a black button and use the environment to his advantage by smashing Fisk through the glass and holding him over a dangerous drop.
Struggles to move with dexterity and experiences violent seizures, indicating physical limitations affecting his ability to act skillfully.
Reacts with physical violence (head butts Fisk) after learning Fisk was hired to sever his spine.
Listens to Fisk’s explanation and questions him about the job and employer rather than immediately lashing out verbally.
Allows Fisk to fall ten feet after knocking him out, showing no immediate mercy or concern for his well-being.
Accepts help and cooperation from Eron despite his own physical weakness and pain.
Holds onto the gun and insists on confronting Panther himself, suggesting determination but not necessarily warmth.
After learning the truth and despite his physical weakness, Grey lifts Fisk up with great effort and head-butts him hard enough to knock him out.
Uses his limited strength effectively to subdue an enemy quickly, showing presence of mind under pressure.
Limping and using wall for support, still manages to carry a gun and follow through with plans to confront people involved.
Asks direct questions and pieces together critical information showing investigative insight.
Physically collapses and sobs painfully when confronted with the betrayal and loss caused by Stem, showing deep emotional vulnerability and anguish.
Asks why Stem helped him if it led back to Stem, indicating a desire to understand despite personal pain.
Shows no aggressive or hostile retaliation verbally or physically in this moment despite intense betrayal.
Writhes in tortured, painful sobs, showing deep emotional anguish.
Presses gun to his head in a suicidal moment, revealing vulnerability and despair.
Shoots a body offscreen with no change in expression, no flinch or blink.
Repeats 'It’s going to be okay' in a calm but dead-eyed manner.
Raises the gun to his head in a moment of extreme emotional turmoil, nearly committing suicide but then calming down and lowering the gun.
Fires a shot at someone offscreen without showing any emotional reaction, maintaining a blank, machine-like expression.
